thread.title: Dog revived following Cleveland house fire | wkyc.com
thread.title_full: Dog revived following Cleveland house fire | wkyc.com

author: Justin McMullen
title: Dog revived following Cleveland house fire | wkyc.com
text: CLEVELAND â€” Firefighters rescued and revived a dog after a fire broke out in a home in [Cleveland's](/cleveland) Stockyards neighborhood on Thursday afternoon. According to a [social media post](https://x.com/ClevelandFire/status/1768327109108203574?s=20) by the Cleveland Division of Fire, firefighters responded to an occupied house fire near the intersection of West 56th Street and Field Avenue. All residents were able to get out of the house. The Cleveland Division of Fire posted photos and a video Thursday afternoon showing medics administering oxygen to the dog, which was revived by medics on scene and handed over Cleveland Animal Care & Control until its owners can be contacted. SUBSCRIBE: [Get the day's top headlines sent to your inbox each weekday morning with the free 3News to GO! newsletter](/email) Firefighters said the fire caused an estimated total of $75,000 in damages. The fire was determined to have been an accident as a result of an electrical issue. Want to be among the first to know the most important local and national news?
